item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: Devoid-of-joy
item.description:
Simplistic interface and portablility.
I don‚Äôt have to spend a day making patches and setting my recording rig up. I originally used it as a sound sketchbook starting out, but now I use it way more than my analog stuff because set up time doesn‚Äôt exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Also, Reason Compact runs top to bottom. It‚Äôs a bit limited in current form, unless you‚Äôre also using desktop Reason (though they provide a Reason Lite license which has quite a bit more functionality than I would have imagined).

Also, and I don‚Äôt care I‚Äôll take a stand on it, aside from Obsidian in Nanostudio 2, Europa is one of the best synths I‚Äôve heard on iOS bar none.

item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: GrooveMaker
item.description:
I use Auxy because it‚Äôs easy to use. I can make notes as short or long as I want them to be. I can also add a sweeper effect or use the sweeper as white noise in my tracks.

item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: Cornea
item.description:
I dont mean to shove my unneeded opinion in here 29 days later, but i mean it aint that hard.

Im not great at music creation on Ableton but it only took 5 months to get the jist of the whole thing. Its a lot easier than you might think. It just looks daunting at first.

item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
You ever try any trackers like Sunvox? Just curious because a tracker is the only other thing I know of that uses a vertical timeline.

Actually that‚Äôs not totally true because pattern arrangement is still left to right. But the guts of a pattern is top to bottom.

I dunno, just spitballing‚Ä¶

item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: JacobJustus
item.description:
The way it has a vertical grid. I don‚Äôt know why but I can‚Äôt function properly with horizontal grids which is why I‚Äôm stuck with auxy. Funny thing is I know how to professionally use computer daws such as Logic Pro x, MainStage, FL studio, Komplete control, and Reaktor but the only thing hindering me is a horizontal grid.

Read full topic

item.title: Why are you using auxy?
item.dc:creator: joshuatuworldwide
item.description:
foryou:

i use ableton mainly, so whenever i get stuck on a song, it‚Äôs nice to take a break, go into auxy, and crank out like 5 songs in one hour.

imma have to agree on this.

Auxy‚Äôs a place (for me) where if you can‚Äôt get a good idea with something that you want in other DAWs (say Logic Pro for example), you could get inspiration from Auxy and be like, ‚Äúhuh so this is pretty cool, lemme put this on the computer‚Äù.

Not to hate on the hardcore Auxy users but this is my own preference. Auxy‚Äôs a very good mobile DAW that can pretty much compete with other DAWs as well.

@Peregrihn one time i messed around a song in Auxy and made a crappy melody with a beat that isn‚Äôt that bad lmao. it‚Äôs true that quality is definitely over quantity but the app is also just somewhere for other producers to just either have a idea dump or just simply mess around with

Read full topic
